summary: "Crouching Tiger, Hidden Dragon" is a 2000 martial arts movie directed by Ang Lee. It's based on a Chinese novel and stars Chow Yun-fat and Michelle Yeoh. The film, made with a $17 million budget, became a big international hit, earning over $213 million. It was the first foreign-language film to make more than $100 million in the U.S. Critics loved it for its story, directing, and action scenes. The movie won many awards, including four Oscars, and is considered one of the best martial arts films ever made.
title: Crouching Tiger, Hidden Dragon
